source.title: Parallel organization of functionally segregated circuits linking basal ganglia and cortex

confidence_rationale: Canonical evidence for parallel, functionally segregated basal ganglia-cortical loops strongly supports REE tri-loop gating over a single global gate.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Basal ganglia-cortical circuits are organized as multiple parallel, segregated loops with distinct functional domains.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports REE tri-loop commitment gating architecture (motor, cognitive-set, motivational) rather than one unitary global gate.
mapping.mapping_caveat: The source provides circuit organization, not a full arbitration algorithm for inter-loop conflicts.
mapping.source_context: Primate neuroanatomy and systems neuroscience review.

confidence_components.notes: Foundational source with direct architectural relevance to loop specialization.
